statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Evansville keeps Bradley winless on road, 66-60
article.headline: Evansville keeps Bradley winless on road, 66-60
article.linkText: Evansville keeps Bradley winless on road, 66-60
article.story: EVANSVILLE, Ind. -- D.J. Balentine scored 24 points, half that amount on 12-for-12 shooting from the free throw line, as Evansville made a 10-point halftime lead stand up for a 66-60 win over Bradley Sunday. The loss continued Bradley's road woes after winning a pair of conference games at home -- including a 69-65 over Northern Iowa to avenge a 34-point loss. The Braves now have lost nine straight games away from home, 12 straight Missouri Valley Conference games on the road and is 2-31 on the road in conference games since knocking off the Purple Aces in Evansville Feb. 6, 2010. Egidijus Mockevicius scored 15 points and grabbed six rebounds for Evansville (10-11, 3-5 Missouri Valley Conference), including three of the team's seven offensive rebounds. Walt Lemon Jr. led Bradley (8-13, 3-5) with 14 points. Tyshon Pickett added 13 points and Auston Barnes and Omari Grier contributed 11 and 10 points, respectively.
